another mother who may 
have low milk supply. This 
practice is not recommended 
as human milk obtained from 
outside the Northern Ireland 
Human Milk Bank carries 
risks as it will not have been 
processed in a way that 
follows accepted guidelines. 
There	are	significant	risks	
associated with using  
informally shared human milk 
as it could be contaminated 
with disease causing bacteria; 
it may contain viruses as a 
result of the mother having 
unknown infections such 
as HIV,
